page.title: 14North Upottery:Leisure 1
page.content: The traditional country sports are still pursued whole-heartedly by some of the farming community.One busy farmer is also the local M.F.H."We don't have no time for reading in our family.A library? Now,that's something I've never been in! We've stopped having the newspaper,too.Usually get the news on television.No,I'm busy enough with the hunting and the farm. Being isolated out here doesn't worry any of us.Even to live in the village would fill us with horror.Riding and fishing,that's what my daughters like". Clay pigeon shoots are popular.One is always a great money-spinner at the village fete.Skittles are played down at the pub,along with darts and snooker,and a tug-of-war team can always be raised.
